name: The 1920s: Part I Quiz | Nostalgia | 10 Questions

questions.text: Songwriter Irving Berlin was born on the Lower East Side of New York City.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He was born in Russia in 1888.

questions.text: Charles Lindbergh's father did what for a living?
questions.explanation:
Politician.

	He was a congressman from Minnesota.

questions.text: In the Broadway version of 'The Jazz Singer' who played the lead?
questions.explanation:
George Jessel.

	Al Jolson played the lead in the movie.

questions.text: Where was America's "Cowboy Philosopher", Will Rogers, born?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma.

	He was born in 1879 and was quoted as saying, 'He never met a man he didn't like'. (At the time, Oklahoma was not yet a state).

questions.text: What was the name of Edgar Bergen's first dummy?
questions.explanation:
Charlie McCarthy.

	Mortimer Snerd and Effie Klinker were his later creations.

questions.text: In 1928 Amelia Earhart flew across the Atlantic Ocean.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Other firsts that year: penicillin discovered, Hoover elected president and Chiang Kai-Shek elected President of China.

questions.text: Where was the locale of F. Scott Fitzgerald's, 'The Great Gatsby'?
questions.explanation:
Long Island's North Shore.

	West Egg and East Egg are based on the actual towns of Great Neck and Sands Point.

questions.text: In what year did the production of Ford's Model A begin?
questions.explanation:
1927.

	Production started on November 1, 1927 and they were produced until February 1932.

questions.text: What was Al Capone's first name?
questions.explanation:
Alphonse.

	He was born in Italy in 1899.

questions.text: Primo De Rivera became the dictator of what country in the 20s?
